"""
 This script define all rates to apply in 2006 to calculate an entire paysheet
 according french fiscal & social rules for a SME.
 """
 global paysheet
 paysheet = context.getObject()
 paysheet_type = paysheet.getPortalType()
 
 employee = paysheet.getDestinationSectionValue()
 company = paysheet.getSourceSectionValue()
 
 # Get Paysheet datas
 gross_salary = abs(paysheet.getGrossSalary())
 start_date = paysheet.getStartDate()
 stop_date = paysheet.getStopDate()
 
 
 ### This part of the script define usefull variables to help us calculate dynamic rates
 
 # Each year, look at http://www.urssaf.fr to complete the table
 ceiling_salary_list = { 2003: 2432.0
 , 2004: 2476.0
 , 2005: 2516.0
 , 2006: 2589.0
 }
 # The default ceiling salary is the last one
 paysheet_year = start_date.year()
 ceiling_salary_available_years = ceiling_salary_list.keys()
 if paysheet_year not in ceiling_salary_available_years:
 paysheet_year = ceiling_salary_available_years[-1]
 ceiling_salary = ceiling_salary_list[paysheet_year]
 
 # Limited salary = salaire plafonnee
 if gross_salary < ceiling_salary:
 limited_salary = gross_salary
 else:
 limited_salary = ceiling_salary
 
 # Check if the employee is executive or not
 if employee.getCareerGrade().endswith('engineer'):
 executive = True
 else:
 executive = False
 
 # Get company related data
 company_birth = company.getCreationDate()
 employee_list = company.Organisation_getEmployeeList( start_date = start_date
 , stop_date = stop_date
 )
 company_size = len(employee_list)
 
 # Get the list of all slice the employee fall in
 salary_slices = {}
 
 # "Char" slice type
 slice_a_value = ceiling_salary
 slice_b_value = ceiling_salary * 4
 slice_c_value = ceiling_salary * 8
 if gross_salary < slice_a_value:
 salary_slices['A'] = gross_salary
 else:
 salary_slices['A'] = slice_a_value
 if gross_salary < slice_b_value:
 salary_slices['B'] = float(gross_salary) - float(slice_a_value)
 else:
 salary_slices['B'] = slice_b_value
 if gross_salary < slice_c_value:
 salary_slices['C'] = float(gross_salary) - float(slice_b_value)
 else:
 salary_slices['C'] = slice_c_value
 
 # "Number" slice type
 slice_1_value = ceiling_salary
 slice_2_value = ceiling_salary * 3
 if gross_salary < slice_1_value:
 salary_slices['1'] = gross_salary
 else:
 salary_slices['1'] = slice_1_value
 if gross_salary < slice_2_value:
 salary_slices['2'] = gross_salary - slice_1_value
 else:
 salary_slices['2'] = slice_2_value
 
 # Age-slice of the company
 old_limit = DateTime(1997, 1, 1)
 if company_birth < old_limit:
 comp_type = 'old'
 else:
 comp_type = 'new'
 
 
 ### This part of the script aggregate base salary and rates.
 
 default = {}
 
 # Initialize all variables to None
 paysheet_services = []
 erp5site = context.portal_url.getPortalObject()
 
 # during 06/2005 service module has been renamed service_module
 # both names are supported
 # XXX This should definitly use portal_catalog !!!
 if hasattr(erp5site, 'payroll_service_module') :
 service_module = erp5site.payroll_service_module
 elif hasattr(erp5site, 'service_module') :
 service_module = erp5site.service_module
 else :
 service_module = erp5site.service
 
 for service in service_module.objectValues():
 base_cat = service.getVariationRangeBaseCategoryList()
 if 'tax_category' in base_cat and 'salary_range' in base_cat:
 paysheet_services.append(service)
 for serv in paysheet_services:
 cat_list = serv.getCategoryList()
 tax_cat = []
 range_cat = []
 for cat in cat_list:
 if str(cat).find('tax_category') != -1:
 tax_cat.append(cat)
 if str(cat).find('salary_range') != -1:
 range_cat.append(cat)
 for base in range_cat:
 mycategory = context.portal_categories.resolveCategory(base)
 if mycategory is None:
 context.log("PaySheetTransaction_preCalculation", "WARNING! Category not found: %s" % base)
 else:
 new_name = serv.getId() + '/' + mycategory.getId()
 default[new_name] = { 'employer_rate': None
 , 'employee_rate': None
 , 'base' : None
 }
 
 # Sickness insurance = Assurance maladie
 if executive:
 employer_rate = None
 employee_rate = 1.15
 else:
 employer_rate = 13.10
 employee_rate = 0.75
 default['sickness_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : employer_rate
 , 'employee_rate' : employee_rate
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Old-age insurance = Assurance vieillesse
 if executive:
 default['oldage_insurance/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : None
 , 'employee_rate' : 6.65
 , 'base' : limited_salary
 }
 else:
 default['oldage_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.60
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.10
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 default['oldage_insurance/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 8.30
 , 'employee_rate' : 6.65
 , 'base' : limited_salary
 }
 
 # Family benefits = Allocations familliale
 if not executive:
 default['family_benefits/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 5.40
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Industrial accident = Accidents du travail
 if not executive:
 default['industrial_accident/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.10
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Lodging helps = Aide au logemenent
 # if company_size > 9:
 # default['lodging_helps/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : 0.40
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 # else:
 # default['lodging_helps/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : 0.10
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : limited_salary
 # }
 
 # Transport payment
 # TODO: rate depending of the town, 1.80 is the 'default' value (when the town isn't referenced by laws)
 if company_size > 9:
 default['transport_payment/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.80
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # CSG
 default['csg_deductible/salaire_brut_csg'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : None
 , 'employee_rate' : 5.10
 , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 }
 default['csg_non_deductible/salaire_brut_csg'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : None
 , 'employee_rate' : 2.9
 , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 }
 
 # CRDS
 # default['crds/salaire_brut_crds'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : None
 # , 'employee_rate' : 0.50
 # , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 # }
 
 # Unemployment insurance = Assurance chomage
 default['unemployment_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 4.04
 , 'employee_rate' : 2.44
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # FNGS
 # Employer rate has changed starting from jul, 1st 2006
 fngs_employer_rate = 0.25
 if start_date >= DateTime(2006, 7, 1):
 fngs_employer_rate = 0.15
 default['fngs/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : fngs_employer_rate
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # ARRCO
 if not executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('1'):
 default['arrco/tranche_1'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 4.5
 , 'employee_rate' : 3.0
 , 'base' : salary_slices['1']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('2'):
 if comp_type == 'old':
 employee_share_rate = 6.0
 employer_share_rate = 9.0
 else:
 employee_share_rate = 8.0
 employer_share_rate = 12.0
 
 default['arrco/tranche_2'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : employer_share_rate
 , 'employee_rate' : employee_share_rate
 , 'base' : salary_slices['2']
 }
 elif salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 default['arrco/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 4.5
 , 'employee_rate' : 3.0
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 
 # AGFF
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 default['agff_tranche_a/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.20
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.80
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 default['agff_tranche_b/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.30
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.90
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 else:
 if salary_slices.has_key('1'):
 default['agff_tranche_a/tranche_1'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.20
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.80
 , 'base' : salary_slices['1']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('2'):
 default['agff_tranche_b/tranche_2'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 1.30
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.90
 , 'base' : salary_slices['2']
 }
 
 # ARGIC
 # TODO: fix the repartition of share rate in case of slice C
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 default['argic/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 12.60
 , 'employee_rate' : 7.70
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('C'):
 # free repartition (20.30% to share between employee & employer)
 default['argic/tranche_c'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 10.15
 , 'employee_rate' : 10.15
 , 'base' : salary_slices['C']
 }
 
 # CET
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 default['cet/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 0.22
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 default['cet/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 0.22
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('C'):
 default['cet/tranche_c'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 0.22
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['C']
 }
 
 # Life insurance = Assurance vie
 # if executive == True and salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 # default['life_insurance/tranche_a'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : 1.5
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 # }
 
 # APEC forfaitaire
 if executive:
 default['apec/forfait'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 3.72
 , 'employee_rate' : 2.49
 , 'base' : 100.0
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 default['apec/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 0.036
 , 'employee_rate' : 0.024
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 
 # Retirement = Retraite forfaitaire
 if executive:
 default['cavcic/forfait'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : 34.58
 , 'employee_rate' : 20.75
 , 'base' : 100.0
 }
 
 # construction tax
 # if company_size > 9:
 # default['construction_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : 0.45
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # training tax
 # default['training_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : 0.50
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # courses tax
 # if company_size < 10:
 # rate = 0.15
 # else:
 # rate = 1.5
 # default['courses_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_rate' : rate
 # , 'employee_rate' : None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # Syntec convention
 # TODO: We can't take the decision based on the CollectiveAgreementTitle since each
 # employee has the right to choose if they want benefit from the insurance or not.
 # We can use instead the social_contract property of the (near-)future HR-related stuff.
 col_agr = employee.getCareerCollectiveAgreementTitle()
 if col_agr not in (None, '') and 'syntec' in col_agr.lower():
 # set the syntec rate according to the employee marital status
 syntec_rate = 0.96
 if employee.getMaritalStatusId() == 'married':
 syntec_rate *= 2
 default['syntec_insurance/salaire_plafonne_syntec'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : syntec_rate
 , 'employee_rate' : syntec_rate
 , 'base' : ceiling_salary
 }
 
 # Add blank lines for wickness holding (= retenue maladie) and pay bonus (= primes).
 # Thanks to this, the accountant has the freedom to add the missing amount of money
 # that this script can't guess.
 default['retenue_maladie/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : None
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : None
 }
 default['primes/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_rate' : None
 , 'employee_rate' : None
 , 'base' : None
 }
 
 return default
